TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SqlMethods extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods that correspond to [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] functions. Methods in the SqlMethods class are only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int DateDiffDay (DateTime startDate, DateTime endDate);
.method public static hidebysig int32 DateDiffDay(valuetype System.DateTime startDate, valuetype System.DateTime endDate) cil managed

Docs.param: The start date for the time period.
The end date for the time period.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of day boundaries between two non-nullable dates.
Docs.returns: The number of day boundaries between the two specified dates.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] `DATEDIFF` function; using `day` to specify the type of time boundary crossed. For more about this [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] function, see [DATEDIFF](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114010) in the Microsoft SQL Server Books Online.

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> DateDiffSecond(valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> startDate, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> endDate) cil managed

Docs.param: The start date for the time period.
The end date for the time period.
Docs.summary: Counts the number of second boundaries between two nullable dates.
Docs.returns: When both parameters are not , returns the number of second boundaries between the two specified dates. When one or both parameters are , returns a value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Corresponds to the [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] `DATEDIFF` function; using `second` to specify the type of time boundary crossed. For more about this [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] function, see [DATEDIFF](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=114010) in the Microsoft SQL Server Books Online.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (string matchExpression, string pattern);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(string matchExpression, string pattern) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be searched for a match.
The pattern, which may include wildcard characters, to match in `matchExpression`.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a specific character string matches a specified pattern. This method is currently only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.
Docs.returns: if matches the pattern; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] `LIKE` functionality cannot be exposed through translation of existing common language runtime (CLR) and .NET Framework constructs, and is unsupported outside of a LINQ to SQL context. The use of this method outside of LINQ to SQL will always throw an exception of type <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (string matchExpression, string pattern, char escapeCharacter);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(string matchExpression, string pattern, char escapeCharacter) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be searched for a match.
The pattern, which may include wildcard characters, to match in `matchExpression`.
The character to put in front of a wildcard character to indicate that it should be interpreted as a regular character and not as a wildcard character.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a specific character string matches a specified pattern. This method is currently only supported in LINQ to SQL queries.
Docs.returns: if matches the pattern; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/add/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] `LIKE` functionality cannot be exposed through translation of existing common language runtime (CLR) and .NET Framework constructs, and is unsupported outside of a LINQ to SQL context. The use of this method outside of LINQ to SQL will always throw an exception of type <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
